pull.title: Makefile: add `-I$(top_srcdir)/{include,src}` to `CPPFLAGS` for precomputed
pull.body: When performing an out-of-source-tree build, regenerating the source files for the precomputed ecmult tables places them outside the source tree. Then, when they are to be compiled, they cannot find the headers they need because the source tree is absent from their include search path. This appears to have been an oversight, as the relevant `-I` options are present in `libsecp256k1_la_CPPFLAGS` but were missing from `libsecp256k1_precomputed_la_CPPFLAGS`. This PR adds them.

repo.name: libsecp256k1
repo.description: Optimized C library for EC operations on curve secp256k1

repo.name: secp256k1
repo.description: Optimized C library for EC operations on curve secp256k1

events.body: Okay, I think this is not how we intend users to build the library, but if this one-line patch makes it work for your use case, there's probably no reason not to accept this patch.

I can reproduce the bug when building out-of-source:
```
src/precomputed_ecmult.c:8:10: fatal error: ../include/secp256k1.h: No such file or directory
    8 | #include "../include/secp256k1.h"
      |          ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
compilation terminated.
```
```
src/precomputed_ecmult_gen.c:6:10: fatal error: ../include/secp256k1.h: No such file or directory
    6 | #include "../include/secp256k1.h"
      |          ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
compilation terminated.
```

Tested that adding `-I$(top_srcdir)/src` is enough to fix it, as @real-or-random [suggested](https://github.com/bitcoin-core/secp256k1/pull/1160#discussion_r1029197729).

---

> as the relevant `-I` options are present in `libsecp256k1_la_CPPFLAGS` but were missing from `libsecp256k1_precomputed_la_CPPFLAGS`.

I'm not sure about it:

https://github.com/bitcoin-core/secp256k1/blob/751c4354d51fb5b10a80764df627b84e1a5ccd4f/Makefile.am#L95

https://github.com/bitcoin-core/secp256k1/blob/751c4354d51fb5b10a80764df627b84e1a5ccd4f/Makefile.am#L76

> Okay, I think this is not how we intend users to build the library

The reason is to build for multiple ABIs (e.g., x86 and x86_64) without needing to make an extra copy of the sources.

> `-I$(top_srcdir)/src` suffices.

Confirmed.

@whitslack 

Nice! Can you also add the comments I suggested above? https://github.com/bitcoin-core/secp256k1/pull/1160#discussion_r1029197729

events.message:
Makefile: add -I$(top_srcdir)/src to CPPFLAGS for precomputed

When performing an out-of-source-tree build, regenerating the source
files for the precomputed ecmult tables places them outside the source
tree. Then, when they are to be compiled, they cannot find the headers
they need because the source tree is absent from their include search
path. This appears to have been an oversight, as the relevant -I options
are present in libsecp256k1_la_CPPFLAGS but were missing from
libsecp256k1_precomputed_la_CPPFLAGS. This commit adds them.

events.body: @whitslack note that we've created a release in the meanwhile : https://github.com/bitcoin-core/secp256k1/releases

issue.title: Update src/secp256k1 subtree to release v0.3.1
issue.body:
There is no strict need for any of the changes in v0.3.1 (compared to the v0.3.0 that's currently subtreed) for Bitcoin Core release builds, but if anyone may compile Bitcoin Core from source using Clang v14+, this will prevent known timing leaks in the signing/keygen logic.

This also includes a CI fix from libsecp256k1 master (on top of 0.3.1) which fixes Wycheproof test vector generation.

I also had to amend some of the linters to avoid enforcing their rules on the .py files in the secp256k1 subtree.

issue.title: Upstream PRs 1160, 1193, 1169, 1190, 1192, 1194, 1196, 1195, 1170, 1172, 1200, 1199, 1203, 1201, 1206, 1078, 1209, 979, 1212, 1218, 1217, 1221, 1222
issue.body:
[bitcoin-core/secp256k1#1160]: Makefile: add `-I$(top_srcdir)/{include,src}` to `CPPFLAGS` for precomputed
[bitcoin-core/secp256k1#1193]: Add `noverify_tests` to `.gitignore`
[bitcoin-core/secp256k1#1169]: Add support for msan instead of valgrind (for memcheck and ctime test)
[bitcoin-core/secp256k1#1190]: Make all non-API functions (except main) static
[bitcoin-core/secp256k1#1192]: Switch to exhaustive groups with small B coefficient
[bitcoin-core/secp256k1#1194]: Ensure safety of ctz_debruijn implementation.
[bitcoin-core/secp256k1#1196]: Drop no longer used variables from the build system
[bitcoin-core/secp256k1#1195]: ctime_tests: improve output when CHECKMEM_RUNNING is not defined
[bitcoin-core/secp256k1#1170]: contexts: Forbid destroying, cloning and randomizing the static context
[bitcoin-core/secp256k1#1172]: benchmarks: fix bench_scalar_split
[bitcoin-core/secp256k1#1200]: Drop no longer used Autoheader macros
[bitcoin-core/secp256k1#1199]: ci: Minor improvements inspired by Bitcoin Core
[bitcoin-core/secp256k1#1203]: Do not link `bench` and `ctime_tests` to `COMMON_LIB`
[bitcoin-core/secp256k1#1201]: ci: Do not set git's `user.{email,name}` config options
[bitcoin-core/secp256k1#1206]: build: Add -Wreserved-identifier supported by clang
[bitcoin-core/secp256k1#1078]: group: Save a normalize_to_zero in gej_add_ge
[bitcoin-core/secp256k1#1209]: build: Add SECP256K1_API_VAR to fix importing variables from DLLs
[bitcoin-core/secp256k1#979]: Native jacobi symbol algorithm
[bitcoin-core/secp256k1#1212]: Prevent dead-store elimination when clearing secrets in examples
[bitcoin-core/secp256k1#1218]: Update overflow check
[bitcoin-core/secp256k1#1217]: Add secp256k1_fe_add_int function
[bitcoin-core/secp256k1#1221]: Update Changelog
[bitcoin-core/secp256k1#1222]: Remove redundant checks.

- made -zkp functions static where possible
- CTIMETEST -> CTIMETESTS
- VG_CHECK_VERIFY(r->n, sizeof(r->n)); -> SECP256K1_CHECKMEM_CHECK_VERIFY

The next PR introduces cmake.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -73,7 +73,7 @@ noinst_HEADERS += examples/random.h
 PRECOMPUTED_LIB = libsecp256k1_precomputed.la
 noinst_LTLIBRARIES = $(PRECOMPUTED_LIB)
 libsecp256k1_precomputed_la_SOURCES =  src/precomputed_ecmult.c src/precomputed_ecmult_gen.c
-libsecp256k1_precomputed_la_CPPFLAGS = $(SECP_INCLUDES)
+libsecp256k1_precomputed_la_CPPFLAGS = -I$(top_srcdir)/include -I$(top_srcdir)/src $(SECP_INCLUDES)
comments.body:
```suggestion
# We need `-I$(top_srcdir)/src` in VPATH builds if libsecp256k1_precomputed_la_SOURCES have been recreated in the build tree.
# This helps users and packagers who insist on recreating the precomputed files (e.g., Gentoo).
libsecp256k1_precomputed_la_CPPFLAGS = -I$(top_srcdir)/src $(SECP_INCLUDES)
```

`-I$(top_srcdir)/src` suffices. We use relative includes throughout the library, and since `src/precomputed_ecmult*.c` believe they live in `-I$(top_srcdir)/src`, everything they include is reachable from there.

+libsecp256k1_precomputed_la_CPPFLAGS = -I$(top_srcdir)/include -I$(top_srcdir)/src $(SECP_INCLUDES)
comments.body:
> _libsecp256k1_precomputed_la_SOURCES have been cleaned from the source tree_

This is not required to trigger the error. Having them in the build tree is enough for it.

Therefore, the comment could be adjusted.

comments.body:
> Hm strange. What are the exact steps you've run to reproduce this?

```bash
$ ./autogen.sh
$ mkdir ../build && cd ../build
$ ../secp256k1/configure
$ make precompute_ecmult precompute_ecmult_gen
$ ./precompute_ecmult
$ ./precompute_ecmult_gen
$ make
```
